content.title: Financial Assistance to Widow/Dependent in case of Death of a Worker- Haryana Labour Welfare Board
content.beneficiary: Widow or dependent of a deceased worker
content.details: The scheme 'Financial Assistance to Widow/Dependent in case of Death of a Worker' is implemented by the Haryana Labour Welfare Board (HLWB), Labour Department, Government of Haryana. Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹2,00,000/- is given to the widow or dependent of the worker working in the industrial and commercial establishments of Haryana state in case of his death due to any reason.
benefits: Under this scheme, financial assistance of ₹2,00,000/- is given to the widow or dependent of the deceased worker.
eligibility: The applicant should be the widow or dependent of a deceased worker.
The deceased worker should have been employed in an industrial or commercial establishment in Haryana.
The deceased worker should have been registered with the Haryana Labour Welfare Board.
There is no maximum limit set for the monthly salary of the worker.
There is no fixed service period requirement for the worker.
The application should be submitted within two years from the date of death of the worker.
documents_required: ID proof of the worker issued by the organization/Smart Card /Office ID Proof
Affidavit (fully dependent upon the deceased worker and earlier he/she has not availed of the said scheme)
Ration Card / ESI Card / Parivar Pehchan Patra (Family ID)

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to provide financial assistance to the widow or dependent of a worker who passed away while working in industrial or commercial establishments in Haryana.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance does the scheme provide?
faqs.answer: The scheme offers a financial assistance of ₹2,00,000/- to the widow or dependent of the deceased worker.

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: The applicant must be the widow or dependent of the deceased worker who was employed in an industrial or commercial establishment in Haryana.

faqs.question: Are there any specific requirements regarding the worker's salary?
faqs.answer: No, there is no maximum limit set for the monthly salary of the worker.

faqs.question: Is there any minimum service period requirement for the worker?
What is the time limit for submitting the application?
faqs.answer: The application should be submitted within two years from the date of death of the worker.

faqs.question: How can I apply for the scheme benefits?
faqs.answer: To apply for the benefits, visit the Official Portal - Antyodaya-SARAL Portal: https://saralharyana.gov.in/
